trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: Standard integration
trans-unit.target: Standard integration

trans-unit.source: The Reach SDK requires the Android Support library (v4).
trans-unit.target: The Reach SDK requires the Android Support library (v4).

trans-unit.source: The fastest way to add the library to your project in Eclipse is Right click on your project -> Android Tools -> Add Support Library....
trans-unit.target: The fastest way to add the library to your project in Eclipse is Right click on your project -> Android Tools -> Add Support Library....

trans-unit.source: If you don't use Eclipse, you can read the instructions [here].
trans-unit.target: If you don't use Eclipse, you can read the instructions [here].

trans-unit.source: Copy Reach resource files from the SDK in your project :
trans-unit.target: Copy Reach resource files from the SDK in your project :

trans-unit.source: Copy the files from the res/layout folder delivered with the SDK into the res/layout folder of your application.
trans-unit.target: Copy the files from the res/layout folder delivered with the SDK into the res/layout folder of your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy the files from the res/drawable folder delivered with the SDK into the res/drawable folder of your application.
trans-unit.target: Copy the files from the res/drawable folder delivered with the SDK into the res/drawable folder of your application.

trans-unit.source: Edit your AndroidManifest.xml file:
trans-unit.target: Edit your AndroidManifest.xml file:

trans-unit.source: Add the following section (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: Add the following section (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: You need this permission to replay system notifications that were not clicked at boot (otherwise they will be kept on disk but won't be displayed anymore, you really have to include this).
trans-unit.target: You need this permission to replay system notifications that were not clicked at boot (otherwise they will be kept on disk but won't be displayed anymore, you really have to include this).

trans-unit.source: Specify an icon used for notifications (both in app and system ones) by copying and editing the following section (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: Specify an icon used for notifications (both in app and system ones) by copying and editing the following section (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: This section is mandatory if you plan on using system notifications when creating Reach campaigns.
trans-unit.target: This section is mandatory if you plan on using system notifications when creating Reach campaigns.

trans-unit.source: Android prevents system notifications without icons from being shown.
trans-unit.target: Android prevents system notifications without icons from being shown.

trans-unit.source: So if you omit this section, your end users will not be able to receive them.
trans-unit.target: So if you omit this section, your end users will not be able to receive them.

trans-unit.source: If you create campaigns with system notifications using big picture, you need to add the following permissions (after the tag) if missing:
trans-unit.target: If you create campaigns with system notifications using big picture, you need to add the following permissions (after the tag) if missing:

trans-unit.source: On Android M and if your application targets Android API level 23 or greater, WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission requires user approval.
trans-unit.target: On Android M and if your application targets Android API level 23 or greater, WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission requires user approval.

trans-unit.source: Please read <link><linkText>this section</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Please read <link><linkText>this section</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For system notifications you can also specify in the Reach campaign if the device should ring and/or vibrate. For it to work, you have to make sure you declared the following permission (after the tag):
trans-unit.target: For system notifications you can also specify in the Reach campaign if the device should ring and/or vibrate. For it to work, you have to make sure you declared the following permission (after the tag):

trans-unit.source: Without this permission, Android prevents system notifications from being shown if you checked the ring or the vibrate option in the Reach Campaign manager.
trans-unit.target: Without this permission, Android prevents system notifications from being shown if you checked the ring or the vibrate option in the Reach Campaign manager.

trans-unit.source: If you build your application using ProGuard and have errors related to the Android Support library or the Engagement jar, add the following lines to your proguard.cfg file:
trans-unit.target: If you build your application using ProGuard and have errors related to the Android Support library or the Engagement jar, add the following lines to your proguard.cfg file:

trans-unit.source: Native Push
trans-unit.target: Native Push

trans-unit.source: Now that you configured Reach module, you need to configure native push to be able to receive the campaigns on the device.
trans-unit.target: Now that you configured Reach module, you need to configure native push to be able to receive the campaigns on the device.

trans-unit.source: We support two services on Android:
trans-unit.target: We support two services on Android:

trans-unit.source: Google Play devices: Use [Google Cloud Messaging] by following the <link><linkText>How to Integrate GCM with Engagement guide</linkText><title></title></link> guide.
trans-unit.target: Google Play devices: Use [Google Cloud Messaging] by following the <link><linkText>How to Integrate GCM with Engagement guide</linkText><title></title></link> guide.

trans-unit.source: Amazon devices: Use [Amazon Device Messaging] by following the <link><linkText>How to Integrate ADM with Engagement guide</linkText><title></title></link> guide.
trans-unit.target: Amazon devices: Use [Amazon Device Messaging] by following the <link><linkText>How to Integrate ADM with Engagement guide</linkText><title></title></link> guide.

trans-unit.source: If you want to target both Amazon and Google Play devices, its possible to have everything inside 1 AndroidManifest.xml/APK for development.
trans-unit.target: If you want to target both Amazon and Google Play devices, its possible to have everything inside 1 AndroidManifest.xml/APK for development.

trans-unit.source: But when submitting to Amazon, they may reject your application if they find GCM code.
trans-unit.target: But when submitting to Amazon, they may reject your application if they find GCM code.

trans-unit.source: You should use multiple APKs in that case.
trans-unit.target: You should use multiple APKs in that case.

trans-unit.source: Your application is now ready to receive and display reach campaigns!
trans-unit.target: Your application is now ready to receive and display reach campaigns!

trans-unit.source: How to handle data push
trans-unit.target: How to handle data push

trans-unit.source: Integration
trans-unit.target: Integration

trans-unit.source: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to create a sub-class of com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.EngagementReachDataPushReceiver and reference it in the AndroidManifest.xml file (between the and/or tags):
trans-unit.target: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to create a sub-class of com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.EngagementReachDataPushReceiver and reference it in the AndroidManifest.xml file (between the and/or tags):

trans-unit.source: Then you can override the onDataPushStringReceived and onDataPushBase64Received callbacks.
trans-unit.target: Then you can override the onDataPushStringReceived and onDataPushBase64Received callbacks.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: The category parameter is optional when you create a Data Push campaign and allows you to filter data pushes.
trans-unit.target: The category parameter is optional when you create a Data Push campaign and allows you to filter data pushes.

trans-unit.source: This is useful if you have several broadcast receivers handling different types of data pushes, or if you want to push different kinds of Base64 data and want to identify their type before parsing them.
trans-unit.target: This is useful if you have several broadcast receivers handling different types of data pushes, or if you want to push different kinds of Base64 data and want to identify their type before parsing them.

trans-unit.source: Callbacks' return parameter
trans-unit.target: Callbacks' return parameter

trans-unit.source: Here are some guidelines to properly handle the return parameter of onDataPushStringReceived and onDataPushBase64Received:
trans-unit.target: Here are some guidelines to properly handle the return parameter of onDataPushStringReceived and onDataPushBase64Received:

trans-unit.source: A broadcast receiver should return null in the callback if it does not know how to handle a data push.
trans-unit.target: A broadcast receiver should return null in the callback if it does not know how to handle a data push.

trans-unit.source: You should use the category to determine whether your broadcast receiver should handle the data push or not.
trans-unit.target: You should use the category to determine whether your broadcast receiver should handle the data push or not.

trans-unit.source: One of the broadcast receiver should return true in the callback if it accepts the data push.
trans-unit.target: One of the broadcast receiver should return true in the callback if it accepts the data push.

trans-unit.source: One of the broadcast receiver should return false in the callback if it recognizes the data push, but discards it for whatever reason.
trans-unit.target: One of the broadcast receiver should return false in the callback if it recognizes the data push, but discards it for whatever reason.

trans-unit.source: For example, return false when the received data is invalid.
trans-unit.target: For example, return false when the received data is invalid.

trans-unit.source: If one broadcast receiver returns true while another one returns false for the same data push, the behavior is undefined, you should never do that.
trans-unit.target: If one broadcast receiver returns true while another one returns false for the same data push, the behavior is undefined, you should never do that.

trans-unit.source: The return type is used only for the Reach statistics:
trans-unit.target: The return type is used only for the Reach statistics:

trans-unit.source: Replied is incremented if one of the broadcast receivers returned either true or false.
trans-unit.target: Replied is incremented if one of the broadcast receivers returned either true or false.

trans-unit.source: Actioned is incremented only if one of the broadcast receivers returned true.
trans-unit.target: Actioned is incremented only if one of the broadcast receivers returned true.

trans-unit.source: How to customize campaigns
trans-unit.target: How to customize campaigns

trans-unit.source: To customize campaigns, you can modify the layouts provided in the Reach SDK.
trans-unit.target: To customize campaigns, you can modify the layouts provided in the Reach SDK.

trans-unit.source: You should keep all the identifiers used in the layouts and keep the types of the views that use an identifier, especially for text views and image views.
trans-unit.target: You should keep all the identifiers used in the layouts and keep the types of the views that use an identifier, especially for text views and image views.

trans-unit.source: Some views are just used to hide or show areas so their type may be changed.
trans-unit.target: Some views are just used to hide or show areas so their type may be changed.

trans-unit.source: Please check the source code if you intend to change the type of a view in the provided layouts.
trans-unit.target: Please check the source code if you intend to change the type of a view in the provided layouts.

trans-unit.source: Notifications
trans-unit.target: Notifications

trans-unit.source: There are two types of notifications: system and in-app notifications which use different layout files.
trans-unit.target: There are two types of notifications: system and in-app notifications which use different layout files.

trans-unit.source: System notifications
trans-unit.target: System notifications

trans-unit.source: To customize system notifications you need to use the categories.
trans-unit.target: To customize system notifications you need to use the categories.

trans-unit.source: You can jump to <link><linkText>Categories</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can jump to <link><linkText>Categories</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In-app notifications
trans-unit.target: In-app notifications

trans-unit.source: By default, an in-app notification is a view that is dynamically added to the current activity user interface thanks to the Android method addContentView().
trans-unit.target: By default, an in-app notification is a view that is dynamically added to the current activity user interface thanks to the Android method addContentView().

trans-unit.source: This is called a notification overlay.
trans-unit.target: This is called a notification overlay.

trans-unit.source: Notification overlays are great for a fast integration because they do not require you to modify any layout in your application.
trans-unit.target: Notification overlays are great for a fast integration because they do not require you to modify any layout in your application.

trans-unit.source: To modify the look of your notification overlays, you can simply modify the file engagement_notification_area.xml to your needs.
trans-unit.target: To modify the look of your notification overlays, you can simply modify the file engagement_notification_area.xml to your needs.

trans-unit.source: The file engagement_notification_overlay.xml is the one that is used to create a notification overlay, it includes the file engagement_notification_area.xml.
trans-unit.target: The file engagement_notification_overlay.xml is the one that is used to create a notification overlay, it includes the file engagement_notification_area.xml.

trans-unit.source: You can also customize it to suit your needs (such as for positioning the notification area within the overlay).
trans-unit.target: You can also customize it to suit your needs (such as for positioning the notification area within the overlay).

trans-unit.source: Include notification layout as part of an activity layout
trans-unit.target: Include notification layout as part of an activity layout

trans-unit.source: Overlays are great for a fast integration but can be inconvenient or have side effects in special cases.
trans-unit.target: Overlays are great for a fast integration but can be inconvenient or have side effects in special cases.

trans-unit.source: The overlay system can be customized at an activity level, making it easy to prevent side effects for special activities.
trans-unit.target: The overlay system can be customized at an activity level, making it easy to prevent side effects for special activities.

trans-unit.source: You can decide to include our notification layout in your existing layout thanks to the Android include statement.
trans-unit.target: You can decide to include our notification layout in your existing layout thanks to the Android include statement.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a modified ListActivity layout containing just a ListView.
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a modified ListActivity layout containing just a ListView.

trans-unit.source: Before Engagement integration :
trans-unit.target: Before Engagement integration :

trans-unit.source: After Engagement integration :
trans-unit.target: After Engagement integration :

trans-unit.source: In this example we added a parent container since the original layout used a list view as the top level element.
trans-unit.target: In this example we added a parent container since the original layout used a list view as the top level element.

trans-unit.source: We also added android:layout_weight="1" to be able to add a view below a list view configured with android:layout_height="fill_parent".
trans-unit.target: We also added android:layout_weight="1" to be able to add a view below a list view configured with android:layout_height="fill_parent".

trans-unit.source: The Engagement Reach SDK automatically detects that the notification layout is included in this activity and will not add an overlay for this activity.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement Reach SDK automatically detects that the notification layout is included in this activity and will not add an overlay for this activity.

trans-unit.source: If you use a ListActivity in your application, a visible Reach overlay will prevent you from reacting to clicked items in the list view anymore.
trans-unit.target: If you use a ListActivity in your application, a visible Reach overlay will prevent you from reacting to clicked items in the list view anymore.

trans-unit.source: This is a known issue.
trans-unit.target: This is a known issue.

trans-unit.source: To work around this problem we suggest you to embed the notification layout in your own list activity layout like in the previous sample.
trans-unit.target: To work around this problem we suggest you to embed the notification layout in your own list activity layout like in the previous sample.

trans-unit.source: Disabling application notification per activity
trans-unit.target: Disabling application notification per activity

trans-unit.source: If you don't want the overlay to be added to your activity, and if you don't include the notification layout in your own layout, you can disable the overlay for this activity in the AndroidManifest.xml by adding a meta-data section like in the following example:
trans-unit.target: If you don't want the overlay to be added to your activity, and if you don't include the notification layout in your own layout, you can disable the overlay for this activity in the AndroidManifest.xml by adding a meta-data section like in the following example:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Categories
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Categories

trans-unit.source: When you modify the provided layouts, you modify the look of all your notifications.
trans-unit.target: When you modify the provided layouts, you modify the look of all your notifications.

trans-unit.source: Categories allow you to define various targeted looks (possibly behaviors) for notifications.
trans-unit.target: Categories allow you to define various targeted looks (possibly behaviors) for notifications.

trans-unit.source: A category can be specified when you create a Reach campaign.
trans-unit.target: A category can be specified when you create a Reach campaign.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that categories also let you customize announcements and polls, that is described later in this document.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that categories also let you customize announcements and polls, that is described later in this document.

trans-unit.source: To register a category handler for your notifications, you need to add a call when the application is initialized.
trans-unit.target: To register a category handler for your notifications, you need to add a call when the application is initialized.

trans-unit.source: Please read the warning about the android:process attribute \<html></html> in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android topic before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: Please read the warning about the android:process attribute \<html></html> in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android topic before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: The following example assumes you acknowledged the previous warning and use a sub-class of EngagementApplication:
trans-unit.target: The following example assumes you acknowledged the previous warning and use a sub-class of EngagementApplication:

trans-unit.source: The MyNotifier object is the implementation of the notification category handler.
trans-unit.target: The MyNotifier object is the implementation of the notification category handler.

trans-unit.source: It is either an implementation of the EngagementNotifier interface or a sub class of the default implementation: EngagementDefaultNotifier.
trans-unit.target: It is either an implementation of the EngagementNotifier interface or a sub class of the default implementation: EngagementDefaultNotifier.

trans-unit.source: Note that the same notifier can handle several categories, you can register them like this:
trans-unit.target: Note that the same notifier can handle several categories, you can register them like this:

trans-unit.source: To replace the default category implementation, you can register your implementation like in the following example:
trans-unit.target: To replace the default category implementation, you can register your implementation like in the following example:

trans-unit.source: The current category used in a handler is passed as a parameter in most methods you can override in EngagementDefaultNotifier.
trans-unit.target: The current category used in a handler is passed as a parameter in most methods you can override in EngagementDefaultNotifier.

trans-unit.source: It is passed either as a String parameter or indirectly in a EngagementReachContent object which has a getCategory() method.
trans-unit.target: It is passed either as a String parameter or indirectly in a EngagementReachContent object which has a getCategory() method.

trans-unit.source: You can change most of the notification creation process by redefining methods on EngagementDefaultNotifier, for more advanced customization feel free to take a look at the technical documentation and at the source code.
trans-unit.target: You can change most of the notification creation process by redefining methods on EngagementDefaultNotifier, for more advanced customization feel free to take a look at the technical documentation and at the source code.

trans-unit.source: In-app notifications
trans-unit.target: In-app notifications

trans-unit.source: If you just want to use alternate layouts for a specific category, you can implement this as in the following example:
trans-unit.target: If you just want to use alternate layouts for a specific category, you can implement this as in the following example:

trans-unit.source: **Example of my_notification_overlay.xml :**
trans-unit.target: **Example of my_notification_overlay.xml :**

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the overlay view identifier is different than the standard one.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the overlay view identifier is different than the standard one.

trans-unit.source: It is important that each layout use a unique identifier for overlays.
trans-unit.target: It is important that each layout use a unique identifier for overlays.

trans-unit.source: **Example of my_notification_area.xml :**
trans-unit.target: **Example of my_notification_area.xml :**

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the notification area view identifier is different than the standard one.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the notification area view identifier is different than the standard one.

trans-unit.source: It is important that each layout uses a unique identifier for notification areas.
trans-unit.target: It is important that each layout uses a unique identifier for notification areas.

trans-unit.source: This simple example of category makes application (or in-app) notifications displayed at the top of the screen.
trans-unit.target: This simple example of category makes application (or in-app) notifications displayed at the top of the screen.

trans-unit.source: We did not change the standard identifiers used in the notification area itself.
trans-unit.target: We did not change the standard identifiers used in the notification area itself.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change that, you have to redefine the EngagementDefaultNotifier.prepareInAppArea method.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change that, you have to redefine the EngagementDefaultNotifier.prepareInAppArea method.

trans-unit.source: It's recommended to look at the technical documentation and at the source code of EngagementNotifier and EngagementDefaultNotifier if you want this level of advanced customization.
trans-unit.target: It's recommended to look at the technical documentation and at the source code of EngagementNotifier and EngagementDefaultNotifier if you want this level of advanced customization.

trans-unit.source: System notifications
trans-unit.target: System notifications

trans-unit.source: By extending EngagementDefaultNotifier, you can override onNotificationPrepared to alter the notification that was prepared by the default implementation.
trans-unit.target: By extending EngagementDefaultNotifier, you can override onNotificationPrepared to alter the notification that was prepared by the default implementation.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: This example makes a system notification for a content being displayed as an ongoing event when the "ongoing" category is used.
trans-unit.target: This example makes a system notification for a content being displayed as an ongoing event when the "ongoing" category is used.

trans-unit.source: If you want to build the Notification object from scratch, you can return false to the method and call notify yourself on the NotificationManager.
trans-unit.target: If you want to build the Notification object from scratch, you can return false to the method and call notify yourself on the NotificationManager.

trans-unit.source: In that case it's important that you keep a contentIntent, a deleteIntent and the notification identifier used by EngagementReachReceiver.
trans-unit.target: In that case it's important that you keep a contentIntent, a deleteIntent and the notification identifier used by EngagementReachReceiver.

trans-unit.source: Here is a correct example of such an implementation:
trans-unit.target: Here is a correct example of such an implementation:

trans-unit.source: Notification only announcements
trans-unit.target: Notification only announcements

trans-unit.source: The management of the click on a notification only announcement can be customized by overriding EngagementDefaultNotifier.onNotifAnnouncementIntentPrepared to modify the prepared Intent.
trans-unit.target: The management of the click on a notification only announcement can be customized by overriding EngagementDefaultNotifier.onNotifAnnouncementIntentPrepared to modify the prepared Intent.

trans-unit.source: Using this method allows you to tune the flags easily.
trans-unit.target: Using this method allows you to tune the flags easily.

trans-unit.source: For example to add the SINGLE_TOP flag:
trans-unit.target: For example to add the SINGLE_TOP flag:

trans-unit.source: For legacy Engagement users, please note that system notifications without action URL now launches the application if it was in background, so this method can be called with an announcement without action URL.
trans-unit.target: For legacy Engagement users, please note that system notifications without action URL now launches the application if it was in background, so this method can be called with an announcement without action URL.

trans-unit.source: You should consider that when customizing the intent.
trans-unit.target: You should consider that when customizing the intent.

trans-unit.source: You can also implement EngagementNotifier.executeNotifAnnouncementAction from scratch.
trans-unit.target: You can also implement EngagementNotifier.executeNotifAnnouncementAction from scratch.

trans-unit.source: Notification life cycle
trans-unit.target: Notification life cycle

trans-unit.source: When using the default category, some life cycle methods are called on the EngagementReachInteractiveContent object to report statistics and update the campaign state:
trans-unit.target: When using the default category, some life cycle methods are called on the EngagementReachInteractiveContent object to report statistics and update the campaign state:

trans-unit.source: When the notification is displayed in application or put in the status bar, the displayNotification method is called (which reports statistics) by EngagementReachAgent if handleNotification returns true.
trans-unit.target: When the notification is displayed in application or put in the status bar, the displayNotification method is called (which reports statistics) by EngagementReachAgent if handleNotification returns true.

trans-unit.source: If the notification is dismissed, the exitNotification method is called, statistic is reported and next campaigns can now be processed.
trans-unit.target: If the notification is dismissed, the exitNotification method is called, statistic is reported and next campaigns can now be processed.

trans-unit.source: If the notification is clicked, actionNotification is called, statistic is reported and the associated intent is launched.
trans-unit.target: If the notification is clicked, actionNotification is called, statistic is reported and the associated intent is launched.

trans-unit.source: If your implementation of EngagementNotifier bypasses the default behavior, you have to call these life cycle methods by yourself.
trans-unit.target: If your implementation of EngagementNotifier bypasses the default behavior, you have to call these life cycle methods by yourself.

trans-unit.source: The following examples illustrate some cases where the default behavior is bypassed:
trans-unit.target: The following examples illustrate some cases where the default behavior is bypassed:

trans-unit.source: You don't extend EngagementDefaultNotifier, e.g. you implemented category handling from scratch.
trans-unit.target: You don't extend EngagementDefaultNotifier, e.g. you implemented category handling from scratch.

trans-unit.source: For system notifications, you overrode the onNotificationPrepared and you modified contentIntent or deleteIntent in the Notification object.
trans-unit.target: For system notifications, you overrode the onNotificationPrepared and you modified contentIntent or deleteIntent in the Notification object.

trans-unit.source: For in-app notifications, you overrode prepareInAppArea, be sure to map at least actionNotification to one of your U.I controls.
trans-unit.target: For in-app notifications, you overrode prepareInAppArea, be sure to map at least actionNotification to one of your U.I controls.

trans-unit.source: If handleNotification throws an exception, the content is deleted and dropContent is called.
trans-unit.target: If handleNotification throws an exception, the content is deleted and dropContent is called.

trans-unit.source: This is reported in statistics and next campaigns can now be processed.
trans-unit.target: This is reported in statistics and next campaigns can now be processed.

trans-unit.source: Announcements and polls
trans-unit.target: Announcements and polls

trans-unit.source: Layouts
trans-unit.target: Layouts

trans-unit.source: You can modify the engagement_text_announcement.xml, engagement_web_announcement.xml and engagement_poll.xml files to customize text announcements, web announcements and polls.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the engagement_text_announcement.xml, engagement_web_announcement.xml and engagement_poll.xml files to customize text announcements, web announcements and polls.

trans-unit.source: These files share two common layouts for the title area and the button area.
trans-unit.target: These files share two common layouts for the title area and the button area.

trans-unit.source: The layout for the title is engagement_content_title.xml and uses the eponymous drawable file for the background.
trans-unit.target: The layout for the title is engagement_content_title.xml and uses the eponymous drawable file for the background.

trans-unit.source: The layout for the action and exit buttons is engagement_button_bar.xml and uses the eponymous drawable file for the background.
trans-unit.target: The layout for the action and exit buttons is engagement_button_bar.xml and uses the eponymous drawable file for the background.

trans-unit.source: In a poll, the question layout and their choices are dynamically inflated using several times the engagement_question.xml layout file for the questions and the engagement_choice.xml file for the choices.
trans-unit.target: In a poll, the question layout and their choices are dynamically inflated using several times the engagement_question.xml layout file for the questions and the engagement_choice.xml file for the choices.

trans-unit.source: Categories
trans-unit.target: Categories

trans-unit.source: Alternate layouts
trans-unit.target: Alternate layouts

trans-unit.source: Like notifications, the campaign's category can be used to have alternate layouts for your announcements and polls.
trans-unit.target: Like notifications, the campaign's category can be used to have alternate layouts for your announcements and polls.

trans-unit.source: For example, to create a category for a text announcement, you can extend EngagementTextAnnouncementActivity and reference it the AndroidManifest.xml file:
trans-unit.target: For example, to create a category for a text announcement, you can extend EngagementTextAnnouncementActivity and reference it the AndroidManifest.xml file:

trans-unit.source: Note that the category in the intent filter is used to make the difference with the default announcement activity.
trans-unit.target: Note that the category in the intent filter is used to make the difference with the default announcement activity.

trans-unit.source: The Reach SDK uses the intent system to resolve the right activity for a specific category and it falls back on the default category if the resolution failed.
trans-unit.target: The Reach SDK uses the intent system to resolve the right activity for a specific category and it falls back on the default category if the resolution failed.

trans-unit.source: Then you have to implement MyCustomTextAnnouncementActivity, if you just want to change the layout (but keep the same view identifiers), you just have to define the class like in the following example:
trans-unit.target: Then you have to implement MyCustomTextAnnouncementActivity, if you just want to change the layout (but keep the same view identifiers), you just have to define the class like in the following example:

trans-unit.source: To replace the default category of text announcements, simply replace android:name="com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.activity.EngagementTextAnnouncementActivity" by your implementation.
trans-unit.target: To replace the default category of text announcements, simply replace android:name="com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.activity.EngagementTextAnnouncementActivity" by your implementation.

trans-unit.source: Web announcements and polls can be customized in a similar fashion.
trans-unit.target: Web announcements and polls can be customized in a similar fashion.

trans-unit.source: Implementation from scratch
trans-unit.target: Implementation from scratch

trans-unit.source: You can implement categories for your announcement (and poll) activities without extending one of the Engagement*Activity classes provided by the Reach SDK.
trans-unit.target: You can implement categories for your announcement (and poll) activities without extending one of the Engagement*Activity classes provided by the Reach SDK.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for example if you want to define a layout that does not use the same views as the standard layouts.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for example if you want to define a layout that does not use the same views as the standard layouts.

trans-unit.source: Like for advanced notification customization, it is recommended to look at the source code of the standard implementation.
trans-unit.target: Like for advanced notification customization, it is recommended to look at the source code of the standard implementation.

trans-unit.source: Here are some things to keep in mind: Reach will launch the activity with a specific intent (corresponding to the intent filter) plus an extra parameter which is the content identifier.
trans-unit.target: Here are some things to keep in mind: Reach will launch the activity with a specific intent (corresponding to the intent filter) plus an extra parameter which is the content identifier.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the content object which contain the fields you specified when creating the campaign on the web site you can do this:
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the content object which contain the fields you specified when creating the campaign on the web site you can do this:

trans-unit.source: For statistics, you should report the content is displayed in the onResume event:
trans-unit.target: For statistics, you should report the content is displayed in the onResume event:

trans-unit.source: Then, don't forget to call either actionContent(this) or exitContent(this) on the content object before the activity goes into background.
trans-unit.target: Then, don't forget to call either actionContent(this) or exitContent(this) on the content object before the activity goes into background.

trans-unit.source: If you don't call either actionContent or exitContent, statistics won't be sent (i.e. no analytics on the campaign) and more importantly, the next campaigns will not be notified until the application process is restarted.
trans-unit.target: If you don't call either actionContent or exitContent, statistics won't be sent (i.e. no analytics on the campaign) and more importantly, the next campaigns will not be notified until the application process is restarted.

trans-unit.source: Orientation or other configuration changes can make the code tricky to determine whether the activity goes into background or not, the standard implementation makes sure the content is reported as exited if the user leaves the activity (either by pressing HOME or BACK) but not if the orientation changes.
trans-unit.target: Orientation or other configuration changes can make the code tricky to determine whether the activity goes into background or not, the standard implementation makes sure the content is reported as exited if the user leaves the activity (either by pressing HOME or BACK) but not if the orientation changes.

trans-unit.source: Here is the interesting part of the implementation:
trans-unit.target: Here is the interesting part of the implementation:

trans-unit.source: As you can see, if you called actionContent(this) then finished the activity, exitContent(this) can be safely called without having any effect.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, if you called actionContent(this) then finished the activity, exitContent(this) can be safely called without having any effect.

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test

trans-unit.target: Now please verify your integration by reading How to Test Engagement Integration on Android.
